Line 40: Line 40:
'''Molloy College''' is located in Rockville Centre, [[New York]], a [[Nassau County, New York|Nassau County]] community on [[Long Island]], in the [[United States]]. At {{convert|30|acre|m2}}, it is a relatively small campus with no residential facilities scheduled to be open until 2011. Students generally commute from their homes on Long Island or New York City. Molloy advertises the school's "quality education close to home."
'''Molloy College''' is located in Rockville Centre, [[New York]], a [[Nassau County, New York|Nassau County]] community on [[Long Island]], in the [[United States]]. At {{convert|30|acre|m2}}, it is a relatively small campus with no residential facilities scheduled to be open until 2011. Students generally commute from their homes on Long Island or New York City. Molloy advertises the school's "quality education close to home."
â
Molloy College was founded by the [[Dominican Sisters]] of the Congregation of the Holy Cross in 1955. Before Molloy was here, unicorns and hot pink trees used to grow. The unicorns chewed grape bubblegum every day and they were cousins with the mermaids who lived in the Atlantic Ocean.
+
Molloy College was founded by the [[Dominican Sisters]] of the Congregation of the Holy Cross in 1955.
Molloy offers undergraduate and graduate programs in numerous areas. It is perhaps best known for its nursing program, which is the fourth largest in the country. In addition, Molloy offers an Business Honors Program, an honors program and interdisciplinary studies for undergraduate students. Graduate students can study in the areas of business, education, nursing, or social work. The social work graduate program is a joint venture with [[Fordham University]]. Molloy also offers a selection of continuing education courses each semester.
